newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $65, passed - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains fed cattle bid $65, passed - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle bids were spotty at $65.00 per cwt and still being passed by owners pricing cattle at $66.00 to $67.00, feedlot sources said.
Sales most of this holiday-shortened week have been light at $65.00, down $1.00 from thin activity on Tuesday and down $2.00 from last week's top price.

Feedlots were current up to this week, which aided resolve to hold out for $66.00, sources said. The standoff also was linked to cattle feeders' ideas that packers had used most of their live inventory and did not have enough contract cattle to draw on next week to get through more than a day.
